Intro

Installable via npm install --save libp2p-switch, it can also be used directly in the browser.

Download

The source is available for download from GitHub. Alternatively, you can install using npm:

$ npm install --save libp2p-switch

You can then require() libp2p-switch as normal:

const libp2PSwitch = require('libp2p-switch')

In the Browser

Libp2p-switch should work in any ES2015 environment out of the box.

Usage:

<script type="text/javascript" src="index.js"></script>

The portable versions of libp2p-switch, including index.js and index.min.js, are included in the /dist folder. Libp2p-switch can also be found on unkpkg.com under

  • https://unpkg.com/libp2p-switch/dist/index.min.js
  • https://unpkg.com/libp2p-switch/dist/index.js

ConnectionManager

Contains methods for binding handlers to the Switch in order to better manage its connections.

Parameters

  1. _switch: any:  

instance

ConnectionManager.prototype.addStreamMuxer

addStreamMuxer(muxer: Muxer): void

Adds a listener for the given muxer and creates a handler for it leveraging the Switch.protocolMuxer handler factory

Parameters

void

enableCircuitRelay(config: any): void

ConnectionManager.prototype.reuse

reuse(): void

Sets identify to true on the Switch and performs handshakes for libp2p-identify leveraging the Switch's muxer.

Returns

void

selectSafe

Uses the given MultistreamDialer to select the protocol matching the given key

A helper method to catch errors from pull streams ending unexpectedly Needed until https://github.com/dignifiedquire/pull-length-prefixed/pull/8 is merged.

Parameters

  1. msDialer: MultistreamDialer:  
    a multistream.Dialer
  2. key: string:  
    The key type to select
  3. callback: function (Error):  
    Used for standard async flow
  4. abort: function (Error):  
    A callback to be used for ending the connection outright

Returns

void

handleSafe

Uses the given MultistreamDialer to handle the given connection

A helper method to catch errors from pull streams ending unexpectedly Needed until https://github.com/dignifiedquire/pull-length-prefixed/pull/8 is merged

Parameters

  1. msDialer: MultistreamDialer:  
  2. connection: Connection:  
    The connection to handle
  3. callback: function (Error):  
    Used for standard async flow
  4. abort: function (Error):  
    A callback to be used for ending the connection outright

Returns

void

Dialer

Manages dialing to another peer, including muxer upgrades and crypto management. The main entry point for dialing is Dialer.dial

Parameters

  1. _switch: Switch:  
  2. peerInfo: PeerInfo:  
  3. ourPeerInfo: any:  
  4. protocol: string:  
  5. callback: function (Error, Connection):  

instance

Dialer.prototype.dial

dial(): Connection

Initializes a proxy connection and returns it. The connection is also immediately dialed. This will include establishing the base connection, crypto, muxing and the protocol handshake if all needed components have already been set.

Returns

Connection

Dialer.prototype._createPrivateConnection

_createPrivateConnection(connection: Connection, callback: function (Error, Connection)): void

If the switch has a private network protector, switch.protector, its protect method will be called with the given connection. The resulting, wrapped connection will be returned via the callback.

Parameters

  1. connection: Connection:  
    The connection to protect
  2. callback: function (Error, Connection):  

Returns

void

handle

observe-connection

Creates a pull stream to run the given Connection stream through the given Observer. This provides a way to more easily monitor connections and their metadata. A new Connection will be returned that contains has the attached Observer.

Parameters

  1. transport: Transport:  
  2. protocol: string:  
  3. connection: Connection:  
  4. observer: Observer:  

Returns

Connection

observer

Takes a Switch and returns an Observer that can be used in conjunction with observe-connection.js. The returned Observer comes with incoming and outgoing properties that can be used in pull streams to emit all metadata for messages that pass through a Connection.

Parameters

  1. swtch: Switch:  

Returns

EventEmitter

plaintext

An encryption stub in the instance that the default crypto has not been overriden for the Switch

Binds to message events on the given observer to generate stats based on the Peer, Protocol and Transport used for the message. Stat events will be emitted via the update event.

Parameters

  1. observer: Observer:  
  2. _options: any:  

Returns

Stats

A queue based manager for stat processing

Extends EventEmitter.

Parameters

instance

Stats.prototype.start

start(): void

Initializes the internal timer if there are items in the queue. This should only need to be called if Stats.stop was previously called, as Stats.push will also start the processing.

Returns

void

Stats.prototype.stop

stop(): void

Stops processing and computing of stats by clearing the internal timer.

Returns

void

TransportManager

Manages the transports for the switch. This simplifies dialing and listening across multiple transports.

Parameters

  1. _switch: any:  

static

TransportManager.prototype.listen

listen(key: String, options: any, handler: function (Connection), callback: function (Error)): void

For a given Transport key, listen on all multiaddrs in the switch's _peerInfo. If a handler is not provided, the Switch's protocolMuxer will be used.
